message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.SY

This paper proposes a new supervised learning rule for multilayer spiking neural networks (SNN) using temporal coding. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses the performance of the proposed method on image classification tasks, indicating that it may also belong to the Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV) sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of error backpropagation, which is a common technique in machine learning, suggesting that it may belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category. The paper also discusses the simplicity and hardware-friendliness of the neuron model used, which may indicate that it belongs to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a new learning rule for SNNs, which are a type of neural network used in control systems, suggesting that it may also belong to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category.
